slides.title: Basic Concepts
slides.content:
**Cost Price (CP):** Price at which item is purchased
**Selling Price (SP):** Price at which item is sold

**Profit:** When SP > CP
Profit = SP - CP

**Loss:** When CP > SP
Loss = CP - SP

slides.title: Profit & Loss Percentage
slides.content:
**Profit Percentage:**
Profit% = (Profit/CP) × 100

**Loss Percentage:**
Loss% = (Loss/CP) × 100

**Example:**
CP = ₹500, SP = ₹600
Profit = 600 - 500 = ₹100
Profit% = (100/500) × 100 = 20%

slides.title: Finding SP from CP
slides.content:
**If Profit% is given:**
SP = CP × (100 + Profit%) / 100

**If Loss% is given:**
SP = CP × (100 - Loss%) / 100

**Example:**
CP = ₹800, Profit = 25%
SP = 800 × (100 + 25) / 100 = 800 × 1.25 = ₹1000

question.questionText: A shopkeeper buys an item for ₹400 and sells it for ₹500. What is the profit percentage?
